required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Comparison of Olanzapine in Combination With a Mood Stabilizer vs Mood Stabilizer Alone, in Mixed Bipolar Patients
clinical_study.official_title: A Double-Blind Placebo Controlled Trial of Divalproex and Olanzapine in Bipolar I Disorder, Mixed Episode

brief_summary.textblock: Whether treatment with olanzapine in combination with mood stabilizer reduces symptoms of both mania and depression more than treatment with mood stabilizer alone, in patients with a mixed episode of bipolar I disorder.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Change in Young Mania Rating Scale (YMRS) Scores From Baseline to Endpoint.
Mean Change in Hamilton Depression Rating Scale-21 (HAMD) Scores From Baseline to Endpoint.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Meeting the Criteria for Mixed Onset of Action
Number of Participants Meeting the Criteria for Mixed Response
Mean Change in Clinical Global Impression for Bipolar Illness Severity (CGI-BP) From Baseline to Endpoint
Number of Patients Hospitalized Due to Relapse of Mania or Depression.
Clinically Significant Laboratory Values - Fasting Cholesterol Change From Baseline
Clinically Significant Laboratory Values - Fasting Triglycerides Change From Baseline
Clinically Significant Laboratory Values - Fasting Blood Glucose Change From Baseline
Clinically Significant Laboratory Values - Bilirubin Total Change From Baseline
Clinically Significant Vital Signs - Body Mass Index Change From Baseline
Clinically Significant Vital Signs - Weight Change From Baseline
Clinically Significant Vital Signs - Percentage of Participants With Baseline-to-Endpoint Weight Increase of at Least Seven Percent (7%)

intervention.description: 15mg, capsules, by mouth every evening, daily for minimum of one day, followed by 5-20mg, capsules, by mouth every evening, daily for remainder of study (6 weeks total).
placebo, capsules, by mouth every evening, daily, for 6 weeks.
dose to maintain blood levels of 75-125 ug/mL, by mouth, twice a day, daily for 52 days (Study Period I and Study Period II).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosed with a mixed episode of bipolar I disorder.
- Have had at least one previous manic or mixed episode associated with bipolar disorder
- You must be between 18 and 60 years old.
- You must be able to visit the doctor's office three times in the first week and then once every week for the next five weeks.
- If you are a female, you must have a negative pregnancy test and be using an effective method of contraception.
Exclusion Criteria:
- You have a diagnosis of schizophrenia, schizoaffective disorder or substance abuse or dependence.
- You have diseases of the intestinal tract, lungs, liver, kidney, nervous or endocrine systems, or blood.
- Have required a recent thyroid hormone supplement to treat hypothyroidism (must have been on a stable dose of the medication for at least 2 months prior to Visit 3).
- You are allergic to any of the medications involved in this study.

overall_official.last_name: Call 1-877-CTLILLY (1-877-285-4559) or 1-317-615-4559 Mon - Fri 9 AM to 5 PM Eastern Time (UTC/GMT - 5 hours, EST)

facility.name: For additional information regarding investigative sites for this trial, contact 1-877-CTLILLY (1-877-285-4559, 1-317-615-4559) Mon - Fri from 9 AM to 5 PM Eastern Time (UTC/GMT - 5 hours, EST), or speak with your personal physician.

clinical_study.keyword: Mixed episode associated with Bipolar I

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Study Period 1 was a 2-28 day day period allowing for screening, divalproex treatment initiation (if appropriate) and washout. Patients meeting diagnostic criteria and having therapeutic serum levels of divalproex in target range of 75 to 125 µg/mL (≥80 µg/mL recommended) during Study Period I, will be randomized into either placebo or olanzapine.

group.title: Olanzapine
group.description: Olanzapine: 15mg, capsules, by mouth every evening, daily for minimum of one day, followed by 5-20mg, capsules, by mouth every evening, daily for remainder of study (6 weeks total). Divalproex: dose to maintain blood levels of 75-125 ug/mL, by mouth, twice a day, daily for 6 weeks (following dose achieved in Study Period I).

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo: placebo capsules, by mouth every evening, daily, for 6 weeks. Divalproex: dose to maintain blood levels of 75-125 ug/mL, by mouth, twice a day, daily for 6 weeks (following dose achieved in Study Period I).

group.title: Olanzapine
group.description: Olanzapine: 15mg, capsules, by mouth every evening, daily for minimum of one day, followed by 5-20mg, capsules, by mouth every evening, daily for remainder of study (6 weeks total). Divalproex: dose to maintain blood levels of 75-125 ug/mL, by mouth, twice a day, daily for 6 weeks (following dose achieved in Study Period I).

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo: placebo capsules, by mouth every evening, daily, for 6 weeks. Divalproex: dose to maintain blood levels of 75-125 ug/mL, by mouth, twice a day, daily for 6 weeks (following dose achieved in Study Period I).

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Body Mass Index (BMI)
measure.description: Body mass index is an estimate of body fat based on body weight divided by height squared.

outcome.title: Mean Change in Young Mania Rating Scale (YMRS) Scores From Baseline to Endpoint.
outcome.description: The YMRS is an 11-item scale that measures the severity of manic episodes. Four items are rated on a scale from 0 (symptom not present) to 8 (symptom extremely severe). The remaining items are rated on a scale from 0 (symptom not present) to 4 (symptom extremely severe). The YMRS total score ranges from 0 to 60.
outcome.population: Intent to Treat analysis. All randomized patients with baseline & at least one post-baseline measure.

group.title: Olanzapine
group.description: Olanzapine: 15mg, capsules, by mouth every evening, daily for minimum of one day, followed by 5-20mg, capsules, by mouth every evening, daily for remainder of study (6 weeks total). Divalproex: dose to maintain blood levels of 75-125 ug/mL, by mouth, twice a day, daily for 6 weeks (following dose achieved in Study Period I).

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo: placebo capsules, by mouth every evening, daily, for 6 weeks. Divalproex: dose to maintain blood levels of 75-125 ug/mL, by mouth, twice a day, daily for 6 weeks (following dose achieved in Study Period I).

measure.title: Mean Change in Young Mania Rating Scale (YMRS) Scores From Baseline to Endpoint.
measure.description: The YMRS is an 11-item scale that measures the severity of manic episodes. Four items are rated on a scale from 0 (symptom not present) to 8 (symptom extremely severe). The remaining items are rated on a scale from 0 (symptom not present) to 4 (symptom extremely severe). The YMRS total score ranges from 0 to 60.
measure.population: Intent to Treat analysis. All randomized patients with baseline & at least one post-baseline measure.

analysis.groups_desc: The overall power of the two co-primary analyses—the probability of simultaneously rejecting both co-primary null hypotheses—for this sample size under assumed effect sizes of 0.5 and 0.45 is estimated as approximately 85-87% and 77-80%, respectively.
analysis.p_value_desc: All tests of treatment effects will be conducted at a two-sided alpha level of 0.05 unless otherwise stated.
analysis.method_desc: Mixed Model Repeated Measures (MMRM) Change = Therapy PooledINV Visit Baseline Baseline*Visit Therapy*Visit. P-value from therapy term in model.

outcome.title: Mean Change in Hamilton Depression Rating Scale-21 (HAMD) Scores From Baseline to Endpoint.
outcome.description: The 21-item HAMD measures depression severity. Items are rated on a scale from 0 (symptoms not present) to a maximum of 2 to 4 (symptom extremely severe) for a total score range of 0 to 60.
outcome.population: Intent to Treat analysis. All randomized patients with baseline & at least one post-baseline measure.

group.title: Olanzapine
group.description: Olanzapine: 15mg, capsules, by mouth every evening, daily for minimum of one day, followed by 5-20mg, capsules, by mouth every evening, daily for remainder of study (6 weeks total). Divalproex: dose to maintain blood levels of 75-125 ug/mL, by mouth, twice a day, daily for 6 weeks (following dose achieved in Study Period I).

group.description: Placebo: placebo capsules, by mouth every evening, daily, for 6 weeks. Divalproex: dose to maintain blood levels of 75-125 ug/mL, by mouth, twice a day, daily for 6 weeks (following dose achieved in Study Period I).

measure.description: The 21-item HAMD measures depression severity. Items are rated on a scale from 0 (symptoms not present) to a maximum of 2 to 4 (symptom extremely severe) for a total score range of 0 to 60.
measure.population: Intent to Treat analysis. All randomized patients with baseline & at least one post-baseline measure.

analysis.groups_desc: The overall power of the two co-primary analyses—the probability of simultaneously rejecting both co-primary null hypotheses—for this sample size under assumed effect sizes of 0.5 and 0.45 is estimated as approximately 85-87% and 77-80%, respectively.
analysis.p_value_desc: All tests of treatment effects will be conducted at a two-sided alpha level of 0.05 unless otherwise stated.
analysis.method_desc: Mixed Model Repeated Measures (MMRM) Change = Therapy PooledINV Visit Baseline Baseline*Visit Therapy*Visit. P-value from therapy term in model.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Meeting the Criteria for Mixed Onset of Action
outcome.description: The original outcome measure was Time to Mixed Onset of Action (at least a 25% reduction on HAMD and YMRS total scores from baseline); however since upper limit of measure of dispersion could not be computed by observed data, which is not allowed on this system, number of patients with event are presented instead.
outcome.population: All randomized participants with both baseline and post-baseline measures. Intention to Treat analysis.

group.title: Olanzapine

measure.title: Number of Participants Meeting the Criteria for Mixed Onset of Action
measure.description: The original outcome measure was Time to Mixed Onset of Action (at least a 25% reduction on HAMD and YMRS total scores from baseline); however since upper limit of measure of dispersion could not be computed by observed data, which is not allowed on this system, number of patients with event are presented instead.
measure.population: All randomized participants with both baseline and post-baseline measures. Intention to Treat analysis.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Meeting the Criteria for Mixed Response
outcome.description: The original outcome measure was Time to Mixed Response(at least a 50% reduction on HAMD and YMRS total scores from baseline); however since upper limit of measure of dispersion could not be computed by observed data, which is not allowed on this system, number of patients with event are presented instead.
outcome.population: All randomized participants with both baseline and post-baseline measures. Intention to Treat analysis.

outcome.title: Mean Change in Clinical Global Impression for Bipolar Illness Severity (CGI-BP) From Baseline to Endpoint
outcome.description: CGI-BP Severity is used by the clinician to record the severity of illness at the time of assessment. The score ranges from 1 (normal, not at all ill) to 7 (among the most extremely ill patients).
outcome.population: Intent to Treat analysis. Number of randomized patients with baseline and at least one nonmissing postbaseline value. Last observation carried forward.

group.title: Olanzapine
group.description: Olanzapine: 15mg, capsules, by mouth every evening, daily for minimum of one day, followed by 5-20mg, capsules, by mouth every evening, daily for remainder of study (6 weeks total). Divalproex: dose to maintain blood levels of 75-125 ug/mL, by mouth, twice a day, daily for 6 weeks (following dose achieved in Study Period I).

measure.title: Mean Change in Clinical Global Impression for Bipolar Illness Severity (CGI-BP) From Baseline to Endpoint
measure.description: CGI-BP Severity is used by the clinician to record the severity of illness at the time of assessment. The score ranges from 1 (normal, not at all ill) to 7 (among the most extremely ill patients).
measure.population: Intent to Treat analysis. Number of randomized patients with baseline and at least one nonmissing postbaseline value. Last observation carried forward.

analysis.method_desc: Type III sums of squares of ANCOVA model: Change= TRT + Pooled Investigator + Baseline.

outcome.title: Number of Patients Hospitalized Due to Relapse of Mania or Depression.
outcome.description: Number of participants hospitalized as a result of relapse of mania or depression.
outcome.population: Intent to Treat analysis. All randomized patients.

outcome.title: Clinically Significant Laboratory Values - Fasting Cholesterol Change From Baseline
outcome.description: Change from Baseline to endpoint in cholesterol: value of cholesterol measure at endpoint minus the value at baseline.
outcome.population: All randomized participants with both baseline and at least one post-baseline measure. Intention to Treat analysis.

outcome.title: Clinically Significant Vital Signs - Percentage of Participants With Baseline-to-Endpoint Weight Increase of at Least Seven Percent (7%)
outcome.description: Percentages of participants in each group who experienced an increase in weight of at least 7% from baseline to endpoint.
outcome.population: All randomized participants with both baseline and post-baseline measures. Intention to Treat analysis.

group.description: Olanzapine: 15mg, capsules, by mouth every evening, daily for minimum of one day, followed by 5-20mg, capsules, by mouth every evening, daily for remainder of study (6 weeks total). group.title: Olanzapine
group.description: Olanzapine: 15mg, capsules, PO at Q HS, daily for 1 week followed by 5-20mg, capsules, PO at Q HS daily for 5 weeks (6 weeks total). Divalproex: dose to maintain blood levels of 75-125 ug/mL, PO, BID, daily for 6 weeks (following d ose achieved in Study Period I)

group.description: Placebo: placebo capsules, PO, at Q HS, daily, for 6 weeks. Divalproex: dose to maintain blood levels of 75-125 ug/mL, PO, BID, daily for 6 weeks (following dose achieved in Study Period I).

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
